definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: He was so careless that he came to class without his book.
sentences.chinese: 他粗心大意上课连书都不带。

definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to write without lifting one's pen from the paper
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
name of a book/reputation as calligrapher
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
